one.title: FIRST DAY: Read the notes and the references.

questions.questionText: 1. Use this space to record how you have seen God's activity during the week. (How has He provided, answered, comforted, reconciled, guided, etc.?)
2. What from the notes, lecture, group sharing or personal study impacted you most in the past week?

two.title:
SECOND DAY: Read Acts 8:1-8.
The apostles continued to preach widely and boldly amid great persecution.

questions.questionText: 3. What opportunities arose because of the persecution?

4. Why was preaching to the Samaritans significant for the Jewish Christians from Jerusalem. (2 Kings 17:6-41 gives background on the Samaritans. John 4 records Jesus's encounter with a Samaritan woman).
5. a. How does this shape your thinking about the impact of the gospel on barriers in the world today (e.g. racial, cultural, class, social, etc.)?
5. b. How does this shape your response to the barriers in your community?

three.title:
THIRD DAY: Read Acts 8:9-40.
Peter confronted a sorcerer, and Philip ministered to an Ethiopian.

questions.questionText: 6. Describe Simon. Do you think Simon truly believed or merely professed belief in Jesus Christ?
7. What do you learn about God from the story of Philip, Simon and Peter?
8. a. The eunuch was reading Isaiah 53:7-8. How does this passage point to Jesus Christ?
8. b. How is God giving you a desire to share the gospel or minister to those you have previously ignored? What steps would you like to take?

four.title:
FOURTH DAY: Read 9:1-19a.
Saul met the Lord on the way to Damascus.

questions.questionText: 9. Whom had Saul been persecuting? What does persecution look like in our world today?
10. What lessons do you learn from God's call to Ananias and his reaction to it?
11. How was Saul different after his encounter with Jesus? What difference has Jesus made in your life?

five.title:
FIFTH DAY: Read Acts 9:19b-30.
Saul preached the good news of Jesus Christ.

questions.questionText: 12. a. What was the people's response to Saul's transformation?
12. b. How did the disciples respond to Saul?
13. How did Saul's new brothers in faith take care of him during trying times? How can fellow believers take care of one another today?
14. Why does God allow hard and painful circumstances in the lives of His people?
15. What is the most important or challenging thing you learned this week?
16. Passage Discovery (homiletics, word study, etc.) for group and administrative leaders: Acts 8:1-9:30
